question: Can I afford a $300,000 home with a $70,000 annual salary and existing debts of $500 per month?
true_answer: Yes, you can afford it. With a 36% DTI and credit score eligibility, consider a 5-20% down payment.

steps.content: Can I afford a $300,000 home with a $70,000 annual salary and existing debts of $500 per month?
Plan: 1) Hand off to home_loan_agent for affordability. 2) Use calculator for DTI. 3) Check credit score via credit_agent. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Provide final answer.
Retrieving knowledge on home affordability criteria.
Typical affordability requires DTI below 36% and good credit score.
Calculating debt-to-income ratio with $70,000 salary and $500 monthly debts.
Calculated monthly income is approximately $5,833. DTI is 36%.
Checking typical credit score requirements for mortgage approval.
Credit score above 620 is generally required. Assuming eligibility unless specified otherwise.
Retrieving information on down payment requirements.
Down payment ranges between 5% and 20% depending on loan type and credit score.
Reviewed all calculations and criteria. Affordability confirmed.
Yes, you can afford it. With a 36% DTI and credit score eligibility, consider a 5-20% down payment.
